clinical_study.brief_title: The Feasibility and Application of Intraoperative Ultrasound to Evaluate Femoral Head Shaping
clinical_study.official_title: The Feasibility and Application of Intraoperative Ultrasound to Evaluate Femoral Head Shaping

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the feasibility of using intraoperative ultrasound to evaluate the femoral head formation; to evaluate the improvement of the forming effect using the intraoperative ultrasound combined with c-arm.

detailed_description.textblock: Ultrasound can provide a multi-directional scan of the femoral head and neck junction, and the range of evaluation is larger than that of the intraoperative c-arm. The study was to assess the feasibility of using intraoperative ultrasound to evaluate the femoral head formation; to evaluate the forming of the femoral head and the improvement of the forming effect using the intraoperative ultrasound combined with c-arm.

primary_outcome.description: Visual analogue scale（VAS）was used to measure the pain score. The minimum and maximum values were 0 and 10. The higher score, the worse pain.
Modified Harris Hip Score (MHHS) scale was used to measure the symptoms of joint. The minimum and maximum values were 0 and 91. The higher score, the better.
Routine postoperative hip CT was used to understand the joint morphology.
Routine hip X-ray at the Dunn position was conducted.

arm_group.description: Ultrasound and c-arm were combined to evaluate intraoperatively conditions
c-arm group was used to evaluate intraoperatively conditions

intervention.description: According to the sequential test, the enrolled patients were divided into ultrasound evaluation group and no ultrasound evaluation group.

study_pop.textblock: According to the sequential test, the enrolled patients were divided into ultrasound evaluation group and no ultrasound evaluation group. Inclusion Criteria included patients with hip pain; Cam type (alpha Angle > 50°) impingement and glenoid labrum laceration.
